Articles.Content:
So i decided to share my whole fanon that i've been working on for years. I got inspired to share it by seeing Sumghai's fanon. Beware, it's gonna be large, though.

Of course, some Kerbal spacecraft--and history are loosely based off of the Human races'. And some Kerbal spacecraft and history are entirely new.

So yeah, i apologize if this is rushed, i just have too many ideas. So yeah--let's begin.

--

**1 - IMPORTANT EVENTS AND KERBALS**

This basically covers famous--or important Kerbonauts whom pioneered to what spaceflight is today.

> 
> **Vadislav Romanov -** First Kerbal in space. Air Force Pilot for the United Arctican Soviet Socialist Republics. (Missions - Spirak 1)
> 
> **Ninel Marcovic -** First female in space. Air Force Pilot for the United Arctican Soviet Socialist Republics. (Missions - Spirak 6)
> 
> **Geoffrey Stokes -** First South Returian in space. South Returian Naval Officer and Test Pilot. (Missions - Harmony-Lapis Lazuli 3, Columbia 14)
> 
> **Danrey Balton -** First Plutonic in space. Test Pilot for the United Plutonic Federations' hypersonic rocketplane program. (Missions - Gorgon 1, Chimera 8, Selene 5, Selene 12)
> 
> **Seested Hajorp -** Third Plutonic in space. Engineer for the Plutonic Royal Air Force. (Missions - Gorgon 3, Chimera 6, Selene 5, Olympus Expedition 1)
> 
> **Jebediah Kerman -** Second Plutonic in space. Test Pilot for the United Plutonic Federations' hypersonic rocketplane program. (Missions - Gorgon 2, Chimera 6, Selene 8)
> 
> MORE COMING SOON!

**2 - MAJOR NATIONS IN THE SPACE RACE**

Coming soon!

**3 - TIMELINE OF THE KERBAL SPACE RACE**

Coming soon!

**4 - PLANETS AND MOONS**

Coming soon!
World-building is always fun to read - I look forward to seeing how this turns out.

> 
> World-building is always fun to read - I look forward to seeing how this turns out.

Thank you!
